title: Automatic conversation compaction near context window limit
description: As conversations approach the context window limit, automatically trigger compaction - summarizing older messages while preserving key context. The SDK may have built-in support for this, or we implement it manually by detecting token count and triggering a summary operation.

title: Prime agent with memory files on client startup
description: When creating a new SDK client for a chat, inject the memory files (observations.md, learnings.md, pending.md) into context so the agent remembers La Boeuf's preferences and pending items. Could be via system prompt or initial file reads.

title: Persist chat history to areas/herald/chat-history/
description: Save conversations to areas/herald/chat-history/{chat_id}/ as markdown files. Provides searchable history the agent can grep, human-readable logs, and context recovery after restarts. Each conversation turn should be timestamped.

title: Periodic memory refresh during long conversations
description: For long conversations, remind the agent every N messages to re-check its memory files in areas/herald/. This keeps context fresh and ensures the agent doesn't forget important preferences mid-conversation.

title: Auto-update memory files with learnings after conversations
description: After conversations end (or at natural breakpoints), have the agent update its memory files with new learnings, observations about La Boeuf's preferences, and any pending follow-ups. Similar to Clawdbot's memory system.

title: Remove timeout and increase max_turns for long-running tasks
description: The current timeout (300s) is defined but never enforced. For long-running research tasks, we should either remove the timeout entirely or set it very high (30-60 min). Also increase max_turns from 50 to 100+ to allow complex multi-step workflows.
close_reason: Removed unused timeout, increased max_turns to 200
